required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Assess Efficacy of cYclosporine Plus Standard of Care in Hospitalized Patients With COVID19
clinical_study.official_title: Open, Controlled, Randomized Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Cyclosporine Plus Standard Treatment vs Standard Treatment Only in Hospitalized Patients With COVID-19 Infection

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

brief_summary.textblock: The study hypothesis is that cyclosporine, added to standard treatment of hospitalized patients with COVID19 infection may improve their prognosis.

primary_outcome.description: efficacy of the association of CsA with standard treatment in reducing the severity of COVID19 infection in hospitalized patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: efficacy of CsA in combination with standard treatment in reducing mortality

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: efficacy of CsA in combination with standard treatment in reducing days in hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days in ICU beds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: efficacy of CsA in combination with standard treatment in reducing days in ICU beds

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: efficacy of CsA in combination with standard treatment in reducing FiO2 needs.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: safety and tolerability of cyclosporine vs standard treatment administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 48 hours from randomization until patient discharge, and at the end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment, depending of what applies)
secondary_outcome.description: change from baseline in C reactive protein levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 48 hours from randomization until patient discharge, and at the end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment, depending of what applies)
secondary_outcome.description: change from baseline in ferritin levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 48h during hospitalization and end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: change from baseline in LDH levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 48 hours from randomization until patient discharge, and at the end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment, depending of what applies)
secondary_outcome.description: change from baseline in Creatin phosphokinase levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 48 hours from randomization until patient discharge, and at the end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment, depending of what applies)
secondary_outcome.description: change from baseline in D Dimer levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 8, 15 and end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: change from baseline in IL-6 levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 8, 15 and end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: change from baseline in KL-6 levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1,8,15 and end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment)
Days 1,8,15 and end of study visit (14 days after discharge or 14 days after end of study treatment)

arm_group.description: The control group will consist on the standard treatment that patients will receive according to hospital standard of care protocol.
The experimental group will consist on cyclosporine added to the standard treatment that patients will receive according to hospital standard of care protocol.

intervention.description: In the experimental group, cyclosporine will be started according to patient weight, and then increased depending on patient tolerance (monitoring renal function and blood pressure)
Standard of care according to hospital protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Women and men over 18 years old
2. Clinical diagnosis of COVID19 infection (to be subsequently confirmed by PCR or specific IgM isotype Ac and with entry criteria according to the protocol of action (see Annex 2)
3. Acceptance and signing of the consent for the study after having received the appropriate information.
Exclusion criteria
1. Known allergy or hypersensitivity to any of the medications included in the treatment arms or to any of their components.
2. Contraindication for the use of any of the medications included (*)
- CsA: IR EST 4.5 (FG <30 ml / min according to the Cockcroft-Gault formula)
- Antimalarials (Chloroquine, hydroxychloroquine): Retinopathy, Myasthenia gravis.
- Lopinavir / ritonavir: severe liver failure
- Remdesivir, darunovir-ritonavir
- Doxycycline, Azithromycin
3. Kidney failure (Stages 4 and 5: GFR <30 ml / min according to the cockcroft-Gault formula).
4. Decompensated liver disease (Child-Pugh stages B or C) or chronic infection with virus B
5. Pregnancy or lactation
6. Age over 75 years
7. Participants in another clinical trial with medication in the 28 days prior to the start of recruitment. Participation in observational studies is allowed.
8. Refusal to participate
9. Patient with a poor state of health or nutrition who, in the opinion of the researcher, has sufficient criteria of severity to interfere with the development of the study or its conclusions
10. At the investigator's discretion, the patient's inability to understand or comply with the study procedures
